website_summaries.verdict: A hilarious contemporary guide to fatherhood with poignant and on-point advice from one dad to another.
pros: Covers everything a modern-day dad could face from babies to older kids with spot-on, hilarious insights
Relatable, funny child-rearing stories are peppered with wisdom
Adapted from Moe’s popular blog, a great non-generic guidebook for fathers out there
A great gift for expectant fathers
cons: This book covers less medical and developmental information than other expectancy books, but delivers helpful information nonetheless

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for funny dads and funny soon-to-be dads
customer_reviews.text: Hilarious, honest, and spot-on. Parenting is terrifying, and this book takes some of the pressure off by coming from a place of truth and humor. You can tell the author actually is a contemporary dad... he covers everything from babies to older kids, including birth plans, what to name your kid, how to deal with annoying children's TV characters, and how to get through your kid's very boring stories. The whole thing is great!
customer_reviews.author: Silvija Lina

customer_reviews.title: A must read for comedy fans with or without kids!
customer_reviews.text: This book is hilarious! I couldn't stop laughing out loud throughout. Moe's perspective on child-rearing is insightful, hilarious, engaging, and hilarious (I said hilarioustwice because it's so funny). Do yourself a huge service and pick this book up!
customer_reviews.author: ben rameaka

customer_reviews.title: Ever scratch your head and wonder why your kid did "that"?
customer_reviews.text: This book may be a Dad's Guide, but if you are a parent you are going to enjoy it. You might even enjoy it if you are watching your friends trying to be parents. From beginning to end the way Doug Moe deconstructs the situations he encounters as a dad are an excellent combination of hilarious and thoughtful. Great read.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Ammon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gift for a dad!
customer_reviews.text: So silly and funny and fun! As a parent of a toddler so much rang true. Also love his blog Man vs Child so I've been excited for this to come out for a long time. Giving this to a few dads this Father's Day!
customer_reviews.author: alene k latimer

customer_reviews.title: Truly one of my favorite books in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Truly one of my favorite books in a long time. Great insights for someone who needed it and did not know it at a time when so much useless information is all around us. After reading it for the third time, I am finding new ways of looking at the challenges of parenting while still laughing–that's hard to do.
customer_reviews.author: 1car69

customer_reviews.title: Child is so good. Most parenting books are generic and even now
customer_reviews.text: For anyone stressing about what to buy a friend with a new baby or a new dad on Father's day, Man vs. Child is so good. Most parenting books are generic and even now, so many of them tend to offer old-fashioned advice. This is so funny and perfectly reflects parenting in 2017. Thank you, Doug Moe, for being hilarious. Also, fast shipping and I loved the brown box it came in, so thumbs up to Amazon for sticking to what they do best.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Black

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, his observations are both hilarious
customer_reviews.text: The title alone says it all. As a dad who does battle every day I can well relate to everything Doug shares here. Fortunately, his observations are both hilarious, and filled with awe and joy; otherwise, this title might well be found in the Horror section. So whether you are seeking a guidebook for future plans, or a brilliant recap of times past, read it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ryan

customer_reviews.title: What a "Dad Book" Should Be
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend this book highly enough. It's laugh-out-loud funny and sprinkled with genuine, down-to-earth commentary on the weird, amazing, chaotic and wonderful thing it is to be a modern-day parent. I'm so glad that Doug Moe adapted his ManVChild.com site (which I found hilarious even before I became a parent) into a full book! I'll be recommending this to all the new parents I know from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kropinak

customer_reviews.title: Parenting is Teamwork
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun read. It's targeted to men and encourages a teamwork ethic to child rearing. For those that believe that childbirth is the woman's job, Moe reminds us that the father has a very important role and takes a lighthearted approach to reinforcing that view.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: and filled with fun, interesting anecdotes that should make every Father stand ...
customer_reviews.text: Hilarious, poignant, and filled with fun, interesting anecdotes that should make every Father stand up and say, "Truth!"
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sarian

customer_reviews.title: you are a terrible father AND a terrible friend
customer_reviews.text: If you don't purchase this book for yourself and buy it for all of your friends by father's day, you are a terrible father AND a terrible friend. In all seriousness, this book is hilarious, charming, and insightful! Definitely recommend - perfect gift and beach reading this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Gideon Evans

customer_reviews.title: This was a great read with a funny twist on some of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not your average child rearing book. This was a great read with a funny twist on some of the realities of parenting. I can't wait to read the sequels - "Man vs Tween" and if he survives that, "Man vs Teenager".
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Drysdale

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and funny read!
customer_reviews.text: I think the wit that Doug displayed came from a very warm and loving heart. I am writing this at Disney Land today, where I am attempting to practice Doug's lessons with my now grown children. Much better than Dr. Oz.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel S. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR FATHER'S DAY,
customer_reviews.text: Funny and wise, this book is the perfect Father's Day gift.
customer_reviews.author: KSR

customer_reviews.title: A Funny, Terrific Read
customer_reviews.text: I treated myself to this book as sort of a pre-Father's Day gift. It's not only hilarious, it also contains a lot of truths. As a new dad I identify with much of what Doug Moe touches on here. And of course, it's great when I find a book that makes me laugh out loud every single page, and this one does just that.
customer_reviews.author: chris barber

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book! Witty
customer_reviews.text: Amazing book! Witty, funny, and refreshing. Told from a dad's perspective but spot on for all parents. If you want a parenting book with an edge, this is the one!
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Benlarbi

customer_reviews.title: Very funny and sweet
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hilarious and heartfelt. I highly recommend this for dads (or moms) who understand the inherent weirdness and secret joys of parenting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So funny!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super, hilarious book on being a dad and on parenting in general! All parents should grab a copy!
customer_reviews.author: Tara V

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: It's a book. It's interesting. Not a dad yet. Fun to read and knowledgeable.
customer_reviews.author: Opal

customer_reviews.title: Not a dad, still a fan!
customer_reviews.text: Love this book, and I'm not even a dad. Bought it for all my friends and coworkers who are having babies.
customer_reviews.author: zachary mack

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious! My new "go to" gift for the dads in my life
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT book for someone who already has kids, who's expecting to have kids or just wants to laugh at people who have kids. I expected to scan a page or two (because I have a one-year-old)...I flew through it. The format is busy parent-friendly. You can read it in small chunks and come back to it which is kind of important to me now that I'm a mom! It contains hilarious insights that are current, realistic and refreshing, complimented by equally funny artwork. Such a fun read. This is going to be my new "go to" gift for Father's Day, expecting dads or anyone with kids who needs a laugh-break.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Plante

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, funny, and thoughtful
customer_reviews.text: This is great for dads of any age, even dads to be. Such a fun read!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Purnell

customer_reviews.title: Great Mother's Day read/Father's Day gift!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a dad or a parent but as a childcare provider I can definitely relate to everything in this book! I read it on Mother's Day, ironically, and once I started I couldn't put it down. My friends are tired of me raving about this book but they'll all be ordering copies anyway! I can finally relate to my dad friends on a whole new level. Doug Moe is creative, clever, and hilarious and he absolutely kills it with this book. His daughter is pretty hilarious, too.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad dad, not a bad book.
customer_reviews.text: Doug Moe draws on his personal experience raising an actual human child, mixes it with his background as a comedic actor and writer, and presents us with an excellent mixture of reality and absurdity, in the form of a tale of modern male parenting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: Smart and Funny
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! It's written by a comedian from Upright Citizens Brigade, and it definitely has that vibe and wit throughout the book. It's funny and informative. What I think I like best is that it is a parenting book my husband will actually read! So it would be a good Father's Day gift, if you need an idea.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customercmx!dkdkmxmnendjeodlrjfnddmdjdmndmdkslapapss!demdksksks

customer_reviews.title: Still Laughing
customer_reviews.text: What a fun read! It's a quick and hilarious trip through the child rearing experience. Lots of lists that you can share with your friends, break out at the baby shower, etc. I can't wait for the next book!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Blaser Thode

customer_reviews.title: it's a pleasure that something like this exists
customer_reviews.text: This book is not just hilarious; it's a pleasure that something like this exists. There are so many parenting books that feel old-fashioned and out-of-date. Especially books for dads, wherein authors tend to truck in clichés about barbecuing and riding lawnmowers and inept dads mixing baby formula in beer pitchers. Instead, this book feels like it understands the pressures and embarrassments of fatherhood in this moment in the world. I laughed not just at the jokes but at the relief in knowing there are other dads out there treading water one-handed just like me.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Ross

customer_reviews.title: HILARIOUS & HEART-FELT
customer_reviews.text: An equal parts reverent-and-irreverent window into the world of parenting, this book had me guffawing on the subway and calling my friends with toddlers to read them various passages aloud. This is now my go-to gift for anyone with-or-about-to-have kids. It's an easy read, packed with jokes AND pathos, both sweet and silly. As a person who has broken her fair share of strollers, the "How to Fold a Stroller" section had me tearing up with laughter. And there are also parts that made my heart swell. Way more than a book should deliver, this one did. Hats off to Mr. Moe, and I hope there's a sequel in the works.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Cox

customer_reviews.title: No stone left unturned
customer_reviews.text: Anything you wondered about raising, feeding, cajoling or just generally raising a kid -- it's all addressed here in some funny way or other. There are also quite a few things I found I didn't *know* I was wondering about, but it turned out I was, if that makes any sense.
customer_reviews.author: Art Vandelay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fathers Day Gift
customer_reviews.text: I am a mom. I like to think a really good mom. So I did the right thing and bought this book for my husband. Now he is an even better Dad. Be a good mom and buy this book for Fathers day or if you just want a perspective that will make you laugh so hard that you pee a little. Buy this book. You are welcome America.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Cipolli

customer_reviews.title: very good book. I was given it to me by ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very, very good book. I was given it to me by myyyyyy wiiiiiife for my very first Father’s Day and I was thrilled to receive it. I could have plowed through it in a weekend but instead I spaced it out over the course of my daughter’s first year and lemme tell ya: that worked out just fine. Doug’s book talks about little babies, slightly older babies, kiddos, young’uns and tots. So really, it’s perfect for all ages. Pick it up! I really liked it and look forward to reading it again in a few years when my baby is a tad older.
customer_reviews.author: Adam and Laura Cozens

customer_reviews.title: Grandparent's Perspective
customer_reviews.text: Doug has written a detailed instructive guide for dads who are facing all of the challenges of raising kids in these changing times, using humor and insight. As Doug’s father. I found this description of the daily challenges in caring for toddlers to pre-teens to be enlightening and, sometimes, surprising! It can serve as an eye-opener and guide to grand-parenting as well.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Moe

customer_reviews.title: Read this book even if you don't have kids!
customer_reviews.text: You may think you need to have kids in order to enjoy this book, but that's not true! This book is really funny and resonates with me, even though I don't have kids of my own yet. I can definitely see how parents would relate to it and love it, but as someone who is preparing for a family, I feel like it's a great primer for what to expect down the road. It's a very funny, sweet, and honest book that you will enjoy, regardless of your circumstances. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Erin C.

customer_reviews.title: It is a great gift for men who really don't get parenting today ...
customer_reviews.text: I am buying this for MY dad who had s last kid 42 years ago. It is a great gift for men who really don't get parenting today or better still who THINK they get parenting today. It is honest, funny, and really makes you feel like "you got this!" I have read a gazillion parenting books but none like this have made me laugh out loud and made me feel better about MY own situation. There's a great balance of full on comedy, like funny hahaha and funny "OUCH" which is what parenting is, after all. I would love a book like this about teen years....
customer_reviews.author: pcat

customer_reviews.title: Two enthusiastic thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.text: A hilarious walk down the strange, and often humorless halls of modern parenting. As an 'unchilded' man, I found the book laugh out loud funny, insightful and smart. Moe's keen humor, style and wit drive the tone of this one of a kind parenting book. Illustrations by Jordan Awan are fantastic. For expecting parents, expecting uncles or aunts, friends of those expecting...anyone who knows anyone who has a child orbiting their life, this book is for you! Two enthusiastic thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.author: Sherief

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a dad who loves comedy!
customer_reviews.text: A lot of books on this topic are patronizing to fathers, but Doug Moe's Man Vs. Child is so much fun to read. Fatherhood is a funny, human thing, and the author shines light on stuff I hadn't even known how to put into words, and finds the humor in all of it. It will de-stress you and reaffirm your feelings about fatherhood.
customer_reviews.author: Cutie Pie

customer_reviews.title: I am no longer on the edge of despair thanks to this book
customer_reviews.text: I just had a child and lived in abject horror to what the hell it would entail, would I be able to pull it off, would this be the end of everything as I know it. Doug Moe's amazing book took me off the ledge and gave that fear the finger. With pure hilarity. GET THIS BOOK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Garlock

customer_reviews.title: BEST DAD BOOK ON THE PLANET
customer_reviews.text: I had such a great time reading this book!! Perfect gift idea for any dad or dad-to-be. Relatable, joyful, insightful, and much more than a cut above in its humor. As a dad who has received quite a few gifts of books about being a father, Doug's is absolutely a standout. I've never had so much fun laughing about being a dad!
customer_reviews.author: B. Harms

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, feels good, reads good
customer_reviews.text: Works equally well as both a parenting book and comedy book. Doug Moe seems to notice more about the world than the rest of us do and calls attention to it in funny, insightful ways. It's also designed really well. It has one of those hardcovers with the printing right on the cover, like the Hardy Boys Mysteries books but more elegant. Looks good on a shelf and feels good in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: PCC

customer_reviews.title: Doug Moe is one of the most consistently funny people performing and writing in NYC
customer_reviews.text: Doug Moe is one of the most consistently funny people performing and writing in NYC. I was privileged to take an improv class with him at the Upright Citizens Brigade, and have followed his work ever since. The blog on which this book is based is an absolute gem. Doug's writing, his acting, his improv... It's all great. There are a lot of books about parenting and raising kids, but only this one has Doug Moe's name on it. In my opinion, that makes it worth your time.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyC

customer_reviews.title: Move over Dr. Spock!!!
customer_reviews.text: Dr. Spock (not the one from Star Trek - the one who wrote the common sense guide to parenting) would be blown away. THIS is a laugh-out-loud book about the real world of parenting and a guide every new dad should read. Congrats, Mr. Moe on sharing your wisdom and your joy with the rest of the world. We needed it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Davis

customer_reviews.title: Parenthood is hard. This book is great.
customer_reviews.text: Entering into the unknown abyss of parenthood is a daunting, horrific undetaking. Luckily, I'm a mother so I have a ton of reading material at my fingertips but little for the other participant in this equation ... until now. Doug Moe's fun, realistic, helpful, hilarious look at parenthood is the perfect gift for the new dad, the old dad or the man who never wanted a child.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Laikowski

customer_reviews.title: can I recommend all dads
customer_reviews.text: Okay, can I recommend all dads, dads-to-be, and anyone who was born because of one get their hands on this. Essential hilarity that speaks right the truth of the struggle. A reminder that sometimes we may be doing this on our own, but we are never alone. This man feels your pain and joy. And he brings them both in this honest take! A fun, whimsical read for all and especially precious to the dads out there.
customer_reviews.author: mund

customer_reviews.title: Literal lols
customer_reviews.text: I used to go to the author’s improv shows in New York whenever I could (and I highly recommend doing the same if you’re in NY—he’s a really talented and funny improviser) and this book is just as funny as he is on stage. A welcome relief from the current news cycle and an all-around entertaining read.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Murray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dads and dads-to-be!
customer_reviews.text: Hilarious! I'm buying this for all my new dad friends. The author brings wit and humor and real life experience to share with his readers. So many laughs. I loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Funny funny funny
customer_reviews.text: This is a hilariously honest book. It's in the vein of Dave Barry, except edgier, in a nerd-like sort of way. :) I've been a fan of Doug Moe's improv shows for a while now, and his book has made me an even bigger fan. An awesomely funny read, you won't regret buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So funny and relatable! I loved the advice and the lols. I bought this book at the bookstore, not on Amazon, but I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry McGuire

customer_reviews.title: " This book is funny, real
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to "new dad" books, they're either overly preachy or too creepily folksy for my taste. What about a book for dads who weren't the star quarterback or the assistant general manager of a Bass Pro? Enter "Man vs. Child." This book is funny, real, and relatable, and normal, human dads will both laugh and get some valuable insights from this kinda book. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazooon Cuuustomer

customer_reviews.title: Must read for dads!
customer_reviews.text: Great book if you are a new dad, old dad, soon to be dad, thinking about being a dad, thinking about your own dad...basically if there is a sentence with dad in it, this book is a good idea. Entertaining, insightful, helpful and, for the audiobook version, funnily read. Thanks to Doug for looking at the often times forgotten dad side of parenting and making it fun.
customer_reviews.author: jkeramidas

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Gift for Dads!
customer_reviews.text: Read a couple passages and knew this would be a great Father's Day gift for so many of our friends who are dads and new to fatherhood! Bought a couple copies and am thankful to have a great gift to send on Fathers Day. Doug Moe is so hysterically funny- I'm glad we could share his writing with friends that don't live in NYC or know UCB. - Veronica Reyes-How
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: hell, yes!
customer_reviews.text: serious insight into the conversations all dads have. definitely making my girlfriends read it!! what another wonderful way for everyone to get a chance to hear the insane journey raising another life can be. Doug is wonderfully honest and funny throughout, making the whole thing sound beautifully terrifying at the same time. I loved every second of it :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great read by someone who clearly knows a thing or ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great read by someone who clearly knows a thing or two about being a dad. Warm, irreverently funny and honest. It's refreshing to read a parent-focused book that isn't condescending or precious.
customer_reviews.author: ADC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for Father's Day!!
customer_reviews.text: Written by one of the funniest actors and fellow dads I know - perfectly distills the insanity that is Fatherhood.
customer_reviews.author: Mark DeLaBarre

customer_reviews.title: So good, so honest
customer_reviews.text: So good, so honest, and so so funny! Good for anyone who's new to the parenting game or to those who have been parents for a while. Or just anyone who's looking for a good laugh. A real treasure of a book!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Required reading for people from earth who can read in english
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that Doug threatened me to buy his book and write a glowing review. Bring it to your inlaws house and read it when you get some "me" time - you'll have some precious laughs to nourish the tiny bit of soul you still possess and if you're discovered you can always claim that your doing homework.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Sample

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This book made me laugh out loud. It is both genuinely insightful and hilarious. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SRG

customer_reviews.title: Love it! In addition to being funny
customer_reviews.text: Love it! In addition to being funny, it's nice to see the trend of dad's being more involved in their children's lives reflected in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M.

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious and true- a must read for dads and non-dads alike
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly funny but also VERY TRUE! The author has hilarious insights into fatherhood in this day and age that's worth the read for anyone, not just dads! I got it for my brother-in-law when my niece was born and ended up keeping it and buying another copy for him. A+
customer_reviews.author: Colby Cook

customer_reviews.title: Very funny take on parenting
customer_reviews.text: Very funny take on parenting. Great gift for new moms and dads - or just dads since Father's day is around the corner.
customer_reviews.author: michelle3657

customer_reviews.title: Funny + Great Advice
customer_reviews.text: Very funny and with legit great advice for new parents. Good gift for new parents, Doug Moe is a very funny writer/comedian from UPright Citizen's Brigade in New York.
customer_reviews.author: Jergens

customer_reviews.title: Doug Moe is the Hemingway of Dads
customer_reviews.text: Like cheese to macaroni, this book makes dads better. My crazy handsome husband was already a pretty decent dad, but after reading this insightful and hilarious book I feel like he's finally earning the "#1 Dad" coffee mug that I'm not allowed to drink from.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie morris

customer_reviews.title: Funny and real
customer_reviews.text: Successfully speaks to all the very normal anxieties one might have about having a kid—but in a very funny, honest, everyman sort-of-way. Bonus: No weird bro-humor or toxic masculinity!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Short

customer_reviews.title: Fun Read!
customer_reviews.text: Fun and smart start to finish, and a great fathers day gift for my friends who just became dads.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Dad-ing and comedy go together quite nicely!
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to having a good sense of humor re: parenting, Doug Moe nails it. It's refreshing to read a parenting book through the eyes of an honest Dad. Buy this book if you're a parent who needs a little reassurance that laughing about it all is a-ok, or if you just want to laugh, in general.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren E. Bahlman

customer_reviews.title: Great read, well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Insightful and delightful! Doug Moe provides a hilarious window into fatherhood, child rearing (is that the same thing?) and beyond. Made me feel better about maybe having kids one day.
customer_reviews.author: Karina A Sahlin

customer_reviews.title: There's something funny written on every single page!
customer_reviews.text: Doug Moe has written a true gem: a hilarious account of preparing for (why do it), and dealing with (without rolling your eyes or sighing), children. It's laugh-out-loud and yet insightful. Who knew Ranch dressing was a gateway drug? Great gift for parents-to-be and those with young children. I can't wait to read: Man vs. Teen. (Hint, hint).
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Laterman

customer_reviews.title: Doug Moe is a good dad
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Doug Moe fan for a long time now. I approve!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Dern

customer_reviews.title: Child is fantastic! Doug Moe recounts his hilarious
customer_reviews.text: Man vs. Child is fantastic! Doug Moe recounts his hilarious, honest, and often endearing, experiences and observations that both parents, and people thinking about becoming parents, will enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Celene Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Finally the guide for the dads.  Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, funny, and filled with true-isms that will have you sharing with family and friends. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Domino

customer_reviews.title: So SO Funny.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the best of its genre. I rarely laugh out loud when reading. With this book I laughed out loud over and over. My wife heard me laugh so often she's reading the book now. I'm buying a copy for my dad for Father's Day.
customer_reviews.author: Malvolio

customer_reviews.title: Fun and funny and I don't even have kids
customer_reviews.text: Fun and funny and I don't even have kids. This reads like one of those super funny essays you come across. I am not much of a reader but this book was suggested to me and I am glad it was. I borrowed his copy and then bought one for a friend. Get it with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious.
customer_reviews.text: This book is good fun - great for parents (even non-Dad parents) and anyone who has ever been around any child ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for new parents!
customer_reviews.text: Man vs. Child is a delight - it's funny and offers relatable advice for seasoned parents and for wide-eyed newbies. As an "un-childed" person, I can attest that you don't have to have a kid to appreciate it either. Makes a great Father's Day prezzie!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Brister

customer_reviews.title: Ya gotta
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is a MUST-READ for dads, children and everyone in between. Doug Moe (sp?) is gifted with the pen. This will make a great father's day gift. Def can't say enough good stuff about Man vs. Child. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Childless women can also enjoy this book.
customer_reviews.text: The funniest book about being a dad that I've ever read! I would buy it again, and I just might.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna M.

customer_reviews.title: As a woman who will likely never be a dad ...
customer_reviews.text: As a woman who will likely never be a dad, but plans to be a mom married to a dad, this book is so hilarious and relatable! buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin W

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So honest and funny! Highly recommend as a gift for humor-loving dads (Or moms! Or non-parents!)
customer_reviews.author: S. Peele

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious and useful read!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not even close to having kids but I think about it constantly and this book was a great, hilarious primer.
customer_reviews.author: @jonnymarbles

customer_reviews.title: They all love it! I don't have any kids
customer_reviews.text: I have bought four copies of this book for my guy friends who are either expecting or just had kids. They all love it! I don't have any kids, just cats, and I think it's funny.
customer_reviews.author: John Flynn

customer_reviews.title: I am not a father, but
customer_reviews.text: I am not a father, but I have one. And even though he's more than three quarters of a century old, I'd imagine that he would find useful insights in this book -- mostly because Doug Moe is a great guy who's literally brimming with insights and humor. But he's also a master storyteller, and that's the true recommendation for this book. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Get this book, it is funny!
customer_reviews.text: Oh yes, this is a good and extremely funny book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for husband and he absolutely loved it. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This book is hilarious! I bought it for husband and he absolutely loved it. Highly recommend!! Great gifts for new dads (or just all dads in general.)
customer_reviews.author: cody lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Dead on, hilarious comedy book, and you don't have to read it all at once. I want children!!!
customer_reviews.author: David McDevitt

customer_reviews.title: This book is so funny and a perfect father's day gift
customer_reviews.text: This book is so funny and a perfect father's day gift! I'm not a parent but have worked in childcare for many years and can identify with all these crazy scenarios and stages of parenting. Kids are weird, parenting is hard and this book is hilarious!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Hensler

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm beyond happy that Doug turned his hilarious PoV on parenting into a book. It's so great- I will re-read this many times!! Love when a book makes me laugh out loud.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! What a fun read, great for father's day!
customer_reviews.author: MJ Pops

customer_reviews.title: funny and wise
customer_reviews.text: You start out laughing, and then you realize that in the midst of a lot of funny glimpses of the absurdity of parenting, Moe has a sane and loving view of being a dad. Great gift for any parent!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Eastus

customer_reviews.title: It's cackling-out-loud-in-public funny and PERFECT for father's day/
customer_reviews.text: As a long time fan of Doug Moe's blog I had extremely high expectations of this book. They were all met. It's cackling-out-loud-in-public funny and PERFECT for father's day/
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harren

customer_reviews.title: It's a great gift for parents and parents-to-be and a fun read ...
customer_reviews.text: Doug is hilarious and his guide to being a dad had me laughing out loud. It's a great gift for parents and parents-to-be and a fun read for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Laugh out loud guide
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, this book is so great and funny. You're gonna laugh your pants off! And it's a great gift for any parent--not just dads! Give it a read, you won't regret it. Just think about where you're reading--I got some weird looks for laughing so loudly in public. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Barter

customer_reviews.title: Remember the name Doug Moe!
customer_reviews.text: Doug Moe is criminally under-rated. This book will hopefully begin to set the record straight. I'm looking forward to seeing a lot more from him!
customer_reviews.author: Stirling McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: It will go down as one of the best books in the history of literature
customer_reviews.text: This book is an instant classic. It will go down as one of the best books in the history of literature. Doug Moe is a paternal adonis.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun, funny take on fatherhood
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun, funny take on fatherhood! I gave it to a friend who recently became a dad and he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnne Loverme

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this book. It was hysterical and informative. Perfect for Father's Day for a new dad.
customer_reviews.author: caitlin

customer_reviews.title: This is great read! So much fun and wonderful insights
customer_reviews.text: This is great read! So much fun and wonderful insights.. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: The Looch

customer_reviews.title: I never know what to get my funny friends who are now dads
customer_reviews.text: I never know what to get my funny friends who are now dads, and this book is perfect for them!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Faas

customer_reviews.title: This book is so great. I got it as a gift for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is so great. I got it as a gift for a friend who just had a kid and they loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Doug is great. You are great. Parenting is hard.
customer_reviews.author: Brodo Swaggins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: There are so few books geared towards dads'. Just buy this book already!
customer_reviews.author: emily r hall

customer_reviews.title: Buy Man vs. Child! Doug Moe is a Comedic Genius.
customer_reviews.text: Man vs. Child is the funniest book I've ever read.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mills
